name: caesar
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] a title used by emperors (= rulers) of ancient Rome: Who was the greatest Caesar? He raised two legions and was soon calling himself "Caesar". Augustus Caesar
the Roman emperor and general Julius Caesar: Caesar invaded Britain from Boulogne.
More examplesFewer examplesManage your provinces well, avoid the assassins, and you're on your way to being the next Caesar.When Maximus is asked to swear allegiance to the new Caesar, he refuses.Tourists can even stand in the portico where Caesar met his end.Like Caesar before him, he might have parlayed military glory into imperial power.
